CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 10, 1962, pg.1, reads: "BIG FAMILY - NO HOUSE - The Alexander Berry family of Ambridge will be evicted from their home for redevelopment purposes. Shown around the wood burning stove in front room, which serves as a living room and bedroom for the entire family, are (left to right, front): Anthony, Linda, Eartha, Sheila, Maroessa [Marpessa], Barbara, Brian, Mrs. Berry, Michael, Alexander Jr. and Mr. Berry.  Absent from the photo are Maxine, Beverly and David."
TitMainTitle: Berry family, from left front row: Anthony, Linda, Eartha, Mrs. Berry, Sheila, baby Marpessa, Barbara; rear: Michael, Alexander Jr. in Sewickley Academy sweatshirt, Brian, and Alexander, gathered around potbelly stove, 241 Banks Street, Ambridge
